byline.contributor: Owen Guo contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Efforts to expand nuclear energy in China by building nuclear power plant in hamlet of Hubin in Henan Province incites protests by local villagers, who oppose threats of decreased air quality and lowered standard of living; rural site is one of dozens across China targeted for construction of nuclear reactors over next decade in effort to decrease China's reliance on coal-fired plants, substantial source of air pollution across country.
lead_paragraph: Hubin Village is among the inland sites where officials plan to build atomic reactors over the next decade, but residents are nervous.

headline.main: China’s Nuclear Vision Collides With Villagers’ Fears
headline.print_headline: China’s Nuclear Vision Collides With Villagers’ Fears

snippet: Hubin Village is among the inland sites where officials plan to build atomic reactors over the next decade, but residents are nervous.
